chapter.title: Lighttable
chapter.para: The lighttable is where you manage all your images, ratings, export and much more …

sect2.title: Lighttable

row.entry: In the central view, your images are shown as thumbs; each thumb has a frame and while the mouse is over an image, the information of rating, color labels and if image is altered in darkroom is shown. Also when the mouse hovers over an image frame the specific image metadata is shown in the metadata panel.

sect2.para: In order to locate where you are in your collection, you have read-only sliders at the extreme border of the window: left/right for your vertical position in the collection, top/bottom (when in zoomable lighttable mode, see below) for your zoom level.

While the mouse is over an image frame, you can access additional actions from your keyboard to apply on the image; here follows a table of key accelerators and assigned actions.
0 – 5 set the rating of the image; if an image has 1 star and you hit the 1 key, the image will be unrated. Pressing r rejects the image.
F1 – F5set a color label for the image
ctrl-ccopy the history stack of the image
ctrl-vpaste the copied history stack on the image
dopen the image in darkroom view for developing
zshow a fullscreen view of the image
At the bottom you have an option to choose between zoomable lighttable view or filemanger view of the thumbnails.
Using the zoomable lighttable view, scroll with your mouse wheel to zoom in and out. Moving the mouse while pressing the left mouse button allows you to navigate through your collection.

While in filemanager you can use ctrl-(mouse wheel) to change the number of thumbs displayed in a row. That action is a key accelerator of the counter that can be found beside the filemanager option. Use your mouse wheel to navigate through your collection.

While in filemanager mode, by pressing ↑/↓ you can scroll (not select) up and down through your collection. In zoomable lighttable ←/→/↑/↓ allow you to move left/right/up/down through your collection. Pressing g goes to the top, shift-g to the bottom.

sect2.title: Filtering and sort order
sect2.para: The filtering and sort order of images on lighttable are accessed and changed in the top bar where you can select among a few predefined filters and ordering like date, color labels or rating among others.
